current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To require the Secretary of the Interior and the Secretary of Agriculture to provide certain
			 Western States assistance in the development of statewide conservation and
			 management plans for the protection and recovery of sage grouse species,
			 and for other purposes.

committee-name.#text: Committee on Environment and Public Works

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Sage Grouse Protection and Conservation Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Sage Grouse Protection and Conservation Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Greater sage-grouse protection and conservation measures

text.#text: In this section:

term.#tail:
means each of the States of California, Colorado, Idaho, Montana, Nevada, North Dakota, Oregon,
			 South Dakota, Utah, Washington, and Wyoming.

text.#text: The term

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Forest System

term.#tail: means the Federal land within the

text.#text: The term

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 11(a) of the
			 Forest and Rangeland Renewable Resources Planning Act of 1974
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Forest and Rangeland Renewable Resources Planning Act of 1974/s:11/ss:a

term.#tail: has the meaning given the term

text.#text: The term

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 103 of the Federal Land Policy and Management Act of
			 1976
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976/s:103

term.#tail:
means the greater sage-grouse (Centrocercus urophasianus) and the Gunnison sage-grouse
			 (Centrocercus minimus).

text.#text: The term
The term

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , with respect to National Forest System land; and

text.#text: the
the

quote.#tail:
means a statewide conservation and management plan for the protection and recovery of sage grouse
			 species within a covered western State.

text.#text: The term

header.#text: Secretarial participation in State planning process

text.#text:
Not later than 30 days after receipt of notice from a covered western State that the State is
			 initiating or has initiated development of a statewide conservation and
			 management plan for the protection and recovery of the sage grouse species
			 within the State, the Secretary shall provide to the Governor of that
			 covered western State—
a commitment of the willingness of the	Secretary to participate in the development;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, as
			 applicable, who shall represent the Secretary as a participant in the
			 development; and

text.#text: a list of designees from the

a list of other Federal departments that could be invited by the covered western State to
			 participate.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
from the covered
			 western State, the Secretary
			 shall provide to the State all relevant scientific data, research, or
			 information regarding sage grouse species and habitat within the State to
			 appropriate State personnel to assist the State in the development.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Sage Grouse Protection and Conservation Act/s:2/ss:b/p:1

text.#text: Not later than 60 days after receipt of a notice described in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
agencies, respectively, available, on at least a monthly
			 basis, to meet with officials of the State to develop or implement a
			 statewide plan.

text.#text: The Secretary shall make personnel from

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Sage Grouse Protection and Conservation Act/s:2/ss:b

text.#text: A notice under
be submitted by a Governor of any covered western State; and
include—
an invitation for the Secretary to participate in development of the statewide plan; and

a commitment that, not later than 2 years after the submission of a notice under this section, the
			 State shall present to the Secretary for review a 10-year (or longer) sage
			 grouse species conservation and management plan for the entire State.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
from the State, the

text.#text:
If the Secretary receives a statewide plan from a covered western State not later than 2 years
			 after receiving a notice under

review the statewide plan using the best available science and data to determine if the statewide
			 plan is likely—
to conserve the sage grouse species to the point at which the measures provided pursuant to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
are no longer
			 necessary in the State; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Endangered Species Act of 1973
usc/16/1531/etseq

text.#text: to conserve the habitat essential to conserve the sage grouse species within the State; and

approve or endorse, or make comments regarding, the statewide plan not later than 120
			 days after the date of submission.

header.#text: Actions after statewide plan is submitted

text.#text:
Not later than 30 days after receipt of a statewide plan from a
			 covered western State, the Secretary shall—
take necessary steps to place on hold—

for a period of not less
			 than 10 years, all actions with respect to listing any sage grouse species
			 in that State under the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Endangered Species Act of 1973
usc/16/1531/etseq

text.#text: enforcement of any current listing of sage grouse species within that State under that Act; and

designation of any critical habitat for any sage grouse species within that State under that Act;
			 and

withdraw any land use planning activities related to Federal management of sage grouse on Federal
			 land within that State and take immediate steps to amend all Federal land
			 use plans to comply with the statewide plan with respect to that State,
			 if—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Sage Grouse Protection and Conservation Act/s:2/ss:b

text.#text:
the State presents to the Secretary the conservation and management plan of the State not later
			 than 2 years
			 after the State submits notice to the Secretary under
the State is implementing the plan.
Any proposed action pursuant to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
that occurs within a covered western State may not be denied or
			 restricted solely on the basis of a sage grouse species if the action is
			 consistent
			 with a statewide plan that has been submitted by the State to the
			 Secretary.
